intro: Corydalis wendelboi, commonly known as the Alpine Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically range in color from pink to purple. The plant has slender, ascending stems and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain the seeds. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its ornamental value and unique floral structure, it is cultivated in some botanical gardens and horticultural collections.
